content: Well a quick overview of my situation. Basically I messed up my paper work at MEPS when I went to go for the national Guard, Long story short (because of my mother's death and me talking about being a Marine all my life) I decided to join the USMC. Well this stuff about MEPS is still haunting me and keeping me from my dream job. Basically I accidentally put "dizziness" down as a "medical problem" which I don't have. Now I got a physical by my doctor, and even got a signed paper saying that there is No DIZZINESS! Well my marine recuiter is saying that that won't work...and that I need to get a physical...well...yea. Ha, just got one there buddy. So any help would be greatly thanked, what do I do?

title: NEED HELP

content: I ask you to bring this question to : Joining the Military Recruiting pages They will be able to provide better answers than our guesses here. Good luck.

title: NEED HELP

content: quote: Originally posted by kiyro: Well a quick overview of my situation. Basically I messed up my paper work at MEPS when I went to go for the national Guard, Long story short (because of my mother's death and me talking about being a Marine all my life) I decided to join the USMC. Well this stuff about MEPS is still haunting me and keeping me from my dream job. Basically I accidentally put "dizziness" down as a "medical problem" which I don't have. Now I got a physical by my doctor, and even got a signed paper saying that there is No DIZZINESS! Well my marine recuiter is saying that that won't work...and that I need to get a physical...well...yea. Ha, just got one there buddy. So any help would be greatly thanked, what do I do? Get a letter from your Dr. explaining your condition, that may help. The military will give you a physical, if you pass you are good to go! In the future post on the Joining the military forum as scpd3045 recommends! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
